III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff
Description The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents History:
1983 AACS; 2015 MR 9, Eff. June 8, 2015
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/20/25, a youth was observed to have climbed the fence of
the facility grounds and go AWOL. There are concerns that the
facility is not adequately staffed to include having guards by the
gates and fence. There are also concerns that the overall well-
being of the youth and their needs are not met in this facility. It is
rare that youth are seen outside with staff.
Additional allegations were received on
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025.
Administrator reported on 08/20/2025 at approximately 9 pm
Youth A broke open his window and attempted to AWOL. Staff 2
and Staff 3 were outside on break when they spotted Youth A
behind the basketball court. Youth A threw a backpack over the
fence and crawled under the fence and walked toward the
cemetery. Staff 2 immediately called over the radio. Staff 2 and
Staff 3 followed Youth A until Law Enforcement arrived on
campus. Law Enforcement found Youth A in a pickup truck parked
in the back of the cemetery. Administrator reported Youth A
reported he was planning on stealing the truck. Administrator said
she reviewed bed check logs, and a room check was conducted
on Youth A at 9:03 pm and Youth A was spotted outside at 9:07
pm. Administrator said ratio is one staff to every two residents,
during sleeping hours ratio is one staff for up to six residents.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. Staff 1
reported he was working on 08/20/2025 and he was assigned to
Youth A’s unit with Staff 3. He said at 9:05pm he covered the unit
when Staff 3 went on break. At 9:10pm he heard Staff 2 call over
the radio and said that Youth A was observed AWOLing. He said
there were four boys on the unit including Youth A. He checked on
the other youths and they were sleeping. He said they conducted
bed check in variable intervals not to exceed 15 minutes. He
2

checked Youth A’s room and found that he had popped open his
window and that’s how he got out.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for one month. Youth A reported on
08/20/2025 he planned to AWOL and go to his mother’s home. He
said he waited for staff to complete bed checks, then ran to the
window, popped the window open, ran to the back of the building,
and that’s when he spotted two staff standing by the back door.
Youth A then threw his back over the fence and crawled under the
fence. Youth A said a few minutes later law enforcement found
him in the cemetery. Youth A said his plan was to steal a vehicle
and drive to his mother’s home. Youth A called himself an escape
artist because he is good at finding ways to escape. He said that
is what they called him at his previous placement. Youth A
reported there is always staff supervising on the unit, so his plan
was to try and escape in between bed checks, but he didn’t know
that staff were outside.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed at the facility on
08/25/2025. Youth B and Youth C both reported they were asleep
and didn’t see Youth A AWOL. Youth B and Youth C reported
there are always staff supervising and did not express any
concerns regarding the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 09/10/2025. Staff 2 has
been working at the facility for four years. She reported on
08/20/2025 at approximately 9:07pm she and Staff 2 were on
break standing by the back door, when she witnessed Youth A
running towards the back gate. She immediately called for
assistance for AWOL. Youth A had a backpack that he threw over
the fence, crawled under the gate, and ran towards the cemetery
that is located behind the facility. She and Staff 3 attempted to
follow Youth A, a few minutes later Law Enforcement arrived and
was able to locate Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 09/10/2025. Staff 3 has
been working at the facility for three years. She reported on
08/20/2025 at approximately 9 pm she completed a room check
on Youth A and Youth A was observed to be sleeping. She went
on break and was outside with Staff 2, and that’s when she and
Staff 2 witnessed Youth A running towards the back gate. Staff 2
called AWOL over the radio. She and Staff 2 followed Youth A
until Law Enforcement arrived and located Youth A sitting in a
parked truck in the cemetery.
Documents Reviewed:
3

• Incident report dated 08/20/2025 written by Staff 2. At
approximately 9 pm Staff 3 completed a room check on
Youth A. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were outside on break at 9:10
pm and spotted Youth A running behind the basketball
court. Staff 2 called AWOL over the radio, as Youth A threw
his bag over the fence and then crawled underneath the
fence. Staff 2 called for assistance, and the police were
contacted. Police arrived and located Youth A in the
cemetery behind the facility, sitting in a parked truck.
• Bed check logs dated 08/20/2025 Youth A was checked
on at 9:03pm (Youth A was observed outside at 9:07 pm)
• Facility Supervision-Sleeping Hours Procedure. Staff
must conduct accountable bed checks at variable intervals
not to exceed 15 minutes by entering each room with a
flashlight to see that the child is in his or her bed
notifications of opening and closing door using the sensor
are captured electronically by monitoring adherence to
licensing rules.
• Facility AWOL (Truancy; Pursuing Resident
Procedure). When a resident truants from a living unit, all
staff in the program are alerted by radio communication.
Staff are expected to pursue residents actively on campus
and off campus so long as it is safe for them to do so.
When a resident has left the facility and they are not within
eyesight of staff on the campus property, the Police
Department is called, and a missing person’s report is filed
within 30 minutes of the resident’s disappearance.
Analysis The facility was found in compliance per interviews with staff and
documentation provided, there is insufficient evidence that the
facility does not have adequate staff or concerns for staff
supervision.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
